text: where do you see some limit on dynamic pages? I have sites that have hundreds if not thousands of dynamic pages
Hi Nicolas, here say that: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/hubdb#hubdb-technical-limits>
I try it, and more than 10 show me 404 page
This is not a Website is only a list page and detail page, nothing more.

…. to me this means that there are 10 sets of dynamic pages you can create. so if you had a resources hubdb table — you could use the same hubdb table for

/white-papers/xxxx
/infograhpics/xxxx
scan you screenshot your hubdb table or export it and send a csv?
are you using html or javscript to generate your cards on the listing page? I see you have a few JS errors
do you want to show me your listing page html/hubl?
I went to the url: <https://aprendizajepermanente.udem.edu.mx/?hsDebug=true>
this shows debug information from hubl
<https://share.zight.com/P8uwyo2r>
I think you should look into how you are querying hubdb, that would be a good first place to start. let me know how this goes

The query it’s ok, the query you show me here its for featured content, for the last 5 assigned, not for the complete list, the errors in JS are because this featured content it’s not assigned jet, then call and empty slider.
One query for the all listing (programas), and one for the featured (destacados)

The hubDB is base in a import from a Drupal website with some changes, i don’t have the way to use the set of 10 pages, maybe if try to modify the table in sets almost. all sets have more than 10 elements
can you screenshot your whole loop for the programas?

after your call
```{% set programas = hubdb_table_rows(table_id, 'limit=10000')```
do
```{% set programas = hubdb_table_rows(table_id, 'limit=10000')
<h2>count: {{ programas|count }}</h2>```
That is a nice way to see how many are actually coming in
I’m using isotope js script for the listing and search and filters
This loops are before to try the dynamic pages loop
The count now are 4, because now only have 4 finished row or complete, but the complete list have 157
okay I’m sorry I thought you had actual errors
you can test your limitations by cloning all those rows in your hubdb table so that you have 200 entries
you will see that the limit is not 10
I try, but let me check again, maybe this time work, the real problem now is i can’t mesure the convertions. Thanks you
if you have dynamic pages setup up, how could you not measure conversions? Please explain
What is causing this to be unmeeasureable?
When I have some landing page for a campaing, to messure the conversion I create a workflow base in the url, but in this case don’t apply because the url is dynamic
